refnamediv.refpurpose: Functions to manipulate mappings from string to variant, as represented in dbus-glib by a GHashTable from string to GValue

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Mappings from string to variant (D-Bus signature a{sv}) are commonly used to provide extensibility, but in dbus-glib they're somewhat awkward to deal with.
These functions provide convenient access to the values in such a mapping.
They also work around the fact that none of the GHashTable public API takes a const pointer to a GHashTable, even the read-only methods that logically ought to.
Parts of telepathy-glib return const pointers to GHashTable, to encourage the use of this API.

refsect2.title: tp_asv_size()
refsect2.programlisting: #define tp_asv_size(asv) _tp_asv_size_inline (asv)
refsect2.para: Return the size of asv as if via g_hash_table_size().
The only difference is that this version takes a const GHashTable and casts it.
Since 0.7.12

refsect2.title: tp_asv_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GHashTable * tp_asv_new (const gchar *first_key, ...);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GHashTable for use with a{sv} maps, containing the values passed in as parameters.
Parameters are stored in slice-allocated GValues and should be set using tp_asv_set_*() and retrieved using tp_asv_get_*().

tp_g_value_slice_new() and tp_g_value_slice_dup() may also be used to insert into the map if required.
g_hash_table_insert (parameters, "account", tp_g_value_slice_new_string ("bob@mcbadgers.com"));

example.title: Using tp_asv_new()
example.programlisting: GHashTable *parameters = tp_asv_new ( "answer", G_TYPE_INT, 42, "question", G_TYPE_STRING, "We just don't know", NULL);

refsect2.para: Allocated values will be automatically free'd when overwritten, removed or the hash table destroyed with g_hash_table_destroy().

listitem.simpara: the name of the first key (or NULL)
type and value for the first key, followed by a NULL-terminated list of (key, type, value) tuples
a newly created GHashTable for storing a{sv} maps, free with g_hash_table_destroy().

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_boolean ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and boolean, return it, and set *valid to TRUE if valid is not NULL.
Otherwise return FALSE, and set *valid to FALSE if valid is not NULL.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location to store TRUE if the key actually exists and has a boolean value

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_boolean(), tp_g_value_slice_new_boolean()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_boxed ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is of the desired type, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it, for instance with g_boxed_copy(), if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The type that the key's value should have, which must be derived from G_TYPE_BOXED
the value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_boxed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_asv_set_boxed (GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key, GType type, gconstpointer value);
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_boxed(), tp_g_value_slice_new_boxed()

listitem.simpara: the type of the key's value, which must be derived from G_TYPE_BOXED

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_take_boxed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_asv_take_boxed (GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key, GType type, gpointer value);
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_boxed(), tp_g_value_slice_new_take_boxed()

listitem.simpara: the type of the key's value, which must be derived from G_TYPE_BOXED

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_static_boxed ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_asv_set_static_boxed (GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key, GType type, gconstpointer value);
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_boxed(), tp_g_value_slice_new_static_boxed()

listitem.simpara: the type of the key's value, which must be derived from G_TYPE_BOXED

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: const GArray * tp_asv_get_bytes (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an array of bytes (its GType is DBUS_TYPE_G_UCHAR_ARRAY), return it.
Otherwise return NULL.

The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_boxed_copy (DBUS_TYPE_G_UCHAR_ARRAY, ...) if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
the string value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_asv_set_bytes (GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key, guint length, gconstpointer bytes);
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_bytes(), tp_g_value_slice_new_bytes()

listitem.simpara: the number of bytes to copy
location of an array of bytes to be copied (this may be NULL if and only if length is 0)

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_take_bytes ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_bytes(), tp_g_value_slice_new_take_bytes()

listitem.simpara: a non-NULL GArray of guchar, ownership of which will be taken by the GValue

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_double ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and has any numeric type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64, guint64 or gdouble), return it as a double, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0.0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the double precision floating-point value of key, or 0.0

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_double ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_double(), tp_g_value_slice_new_double()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_int32 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a gint32, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 32-bit signed integer value of key, or 0

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_int32 ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_int32(), tp_g_value_slice_new_int()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_int64 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a gint64, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 64-bit signed integer value of key, or 0

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_int64 ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_int64(), tp_g_value_slice_new_int64()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_object_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar * tp_asv_get_object_path (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an object path, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdup() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
the object-path value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_object_path ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_object_path(), tp_g_value_slice_new_object_path()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_take_object_path ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_object_path(), tp_g_value_slice_new_take_object_path()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_static_object_path ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_object_path(), tp_g_value_slice_new_static_object_path()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar * tp_asv_get_string (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is a string, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdup() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
the string value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_string ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_string(), tp_g_value_slice_new_string()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_take_string ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_string(), tp_g_value_slice_new_take_string()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_static_string ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_string(), tp_g_value_slice_new_static_string()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_strv ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar * const * tp_asv_get_strv (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an array of strings (strv), return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdupv() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
the NULL-terminated string-array value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_strv ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_strv()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a guint32, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 32-bit unsigned integer value of key, or 0

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_uint32(), tp_g_value_slice_new_uint()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and is non-negative, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 64-bit unsigned integer value of key, or 0

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_set_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: Stores the value in the map.
The value is stored as a slice-allocated GValue.
See Also: tp_asv_new(), tp_asv_get_uint64(), tp_g_value_slice_new_uint64()
Since 0.7.29

refsect2.title: tp_asv_lookup ()
refsect2.programlisting: const GValue * tp_asv_lookup (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, return it. Otherwise return NULL.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
the value of key, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_dump ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_asv_dump (GHashTable *asv);
refsect2.para: Dumps the a{sv} map to the debugging console.
The purpose of this function is give the programmer the ability to easily inspect the contents of an a{sv} map for debugging purposes.
